services.description: List all Oracle Database Cloud Service instances

outputLevel.description: Flag that specifies that the response is to include the full set of details for each service instance. Only allowed value at this time is 'verbose'.

service.description: List an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

create-service.description: Create an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

config-payload.description: Path to JSON file containing Oracle Database Cloud Service provisioning configuration parameters

delete-service.description: Delete an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

stop.description: Stop an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

lifecycleState.description: Type of lifecycle state request. Valid values include ['stop']

start.description: Start an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

lifecycleState.description: Type of lifecycle state request. Valid values include ['start']

restart.description: Restart an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

lifecycleState.description: Type of lifecycle state request. Valid values include ['restart']

scale-up.description: Scale up the shape (OCPUs and memory) or storage of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

shape.description:
Desired Oracle Compute Cloud shape to scale the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance up to. This attribute is required. Allowed values are, 
 1) oc3 (1 OCPU with 7.5 GB RAM) 
 2) oc4 (2 OCPUs with 15 GB RAM) 
 3) oc5 (4 OCPUs with 30 GB RAM) 
 4) oc6 (8 OCPUs with 60 GB RAM) 
 5) oc7 (16 OCPUs with 120 GB RAM) 
 6) oc2m (2 OCPUs with 30 GB RAM) 
 7) oc3m (4 OCPUs with 60 GB RAM) 
 8) oc4m (8 OCPUs with 120 GB RAM) 
 9) oc5m (16 OCPUs with 240 GB RAM) 
 Specified value must be greater than the service instance's current shape. Either this parameter or the additionalStorage parameter must be specified.

additionalStorage.description: A string containing the size in GB of the storage volume to add to the service instance. This size can be from "1" to "1000" in increments of 1 GB. Either this parameter or the shape parameter must be specified.

usage.description: Specify which specific volume needs to be extended with additional storage. Valid values include ['data','fra']. If usage is 'data', additional storage will be used to extend data storage volume. If usage is 'fra', additional storage will be used to extend backup storage volume. If usage is not specified, but additional storage is specified, a new storage volume will be created.

scale-down.description: Scale down the shape (OCPUs and memory) of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance. You cannot remove block storage from a storage volume.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

shape.description:
Desired Oracle Compute Cloud shape to scale the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance down to. This attribute is required. Allowed values are, 
 1) oc3 (1 OCPU with 7.5 GB RAM) 
 2) oc4 (2 OCPUs with 15 GB RAM) 
 3) oc5 (4 OCPUs with 30 GB RAM) 
 4) oc6 (8 OCPUs with 60 GB RAM) 
 5) oc7 (16 OCPUs with 120 GB RAM) 
 6) oc2m (2 OCPUs with 30 GB RAM) 
 7) oc3m (4 OCPUs with 60 GB RAM) 
 8) oc4m (8 OCPUs with 120 GB RAM) 
 9) oc5m (16 OCPUs with 240 GB RAM) 
 Specified value must be smaller than the service instance's current shape.

view-backups.description: List all backups of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

backup.description: Initiate an on-demand backup for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

recover.description: Recover an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance from the specified backup

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

config-payload.description: Path to JSON file containing Oracle Database Cloud Service recovery configuration parameters. For a list of supported configuration parameters, see documentation at the link provided in EXAMPLES.

switchover.description: Switch a primary Oracle Database Cloud Service instance into a standby and vice versa

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

action.description: Action to perform. Valid values include ['switchover']

failover.description: Make a standby Oracle Database Cloud Service instance as primary. This is usually done when primary instance is unstable. After failover, the standby instance will become primary and original primary instance will be shutdown.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

force.description: Flag used to force failover request. Force should be used with caution as this could result in data loss. You should run 'dbaascli dataguard status --details yes' on service VMs to review current data guard status before using force option.

action.description: Action to perform. Valid values include ['failover']

reinstate.description: When the user performs failover, the standby Oracle Database Cloud Service instance becomes new primary and original primary instance is shut down. Reinstate action is used to start old primary instance as a standby instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

action.description: Action to perform. Valid values include ['reinstate']

available-patches.description: List all available patches for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

applied-patches.description: List all applied patches for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

filter.description: String used to filter the results. Valid operatives include :  =, !=, >=, and <=. For example, to filter the results on a specific patch category and type, set the filter as follows :  patchCategory=general,patchType!=security.  This value defaults to null.

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

precheck-patch.description:
Precheck to identify potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from completing successfully without actually patching the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions: 
  1) Disk space shortage 
 2) Database connectivity failure 
 3) Server access failure 
 4) Storage access failure 
 Prechecks do not check whether another administration task (backup, restoration, or scaling) is in progress, which would prevent patching.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

patchId.description: Patch Id for the patch that requires to have a precheck done.

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

patch.description: Apply a patch to an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

patchId.description: Patch Id. To retrieve the Patch Id, use available-patches command.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

patch.example: psm dbcs patch -s ExampleInstance -p es-20831110-EE -g NODE-SAFE -h REQUIRE_STATUS_HA -t 100 -n Applying JDK80 patch

rollback.description: Roll back a patch for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

rollbackId.description: Id of the patch operation to be rolled back. To retrieve the rollback Id, use applied-patches command.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

rollback.example: psm dbcs rollback -s ExampleInstance -r 13 -n Rolling back the JDK patch

snapshots.description: List all the storage snapshots of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

snapshot.description: List the storage snapshot of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

create-snapshot.description: Create a snapshot of the storage volumes of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

delete-snapshot.description: Delete a storage snapshot of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance. Note: A snapshot cannot be deleted if there are any service instances cloned from it.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

replace-database-using-backup.description: Replace the database in an existing Oracle Database Cloud Service instance hosting a single-instance database using a backup of another database. The backup must have been created by Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service and stored in an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Additionally, the database contained by the cloud backup must meet certain requirements:It must be at version 11.2.0.4.0 or version 12.1.0.2.0 with the latest PSU (patch set update) applied. If it is an Oracle 12c database, it must be multitenant (CDB). Database Cloud Service does not support non-CDB Oracle 12c databases. It must use File System or ASM as its storage method for data files.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

ibkupDatabaseID.description: Database id of the database from which the existing cloud backup was created

ibkupDecryptionKey.description: Password used to create the existing, password-encrypted cloud backup. This password is used to decrypt the backup.

ibkupCloudStorageContainer.description: Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the existing cloud backup is stored

ibkupCloudStorageUser.description: User name of an Oracle Cloud user who has read access to the container specified in ibkupCloudStorageContainer

ibkupCloudStoragePassword.description: Password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in ibkupCloudStorageUser

operation-status.description: View status of an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance operation

activities.description: View activities for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: Service type (hidden constant)

fromStartDate.description: Get activities that were created after this date. Can be used along with 'toStartDate' to get activities created within a date range. Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss and yyyy-MM-dd

toStartDate.description: Get activities that were created before this date. Can be used along with 'fromStartDate' to get activities created within a date range. Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss and yyyy-MM-dd

limitRowCount.description: Maximum number of activities to display. Default is 10.

offset.description: Include activities starting at this position in the result set. 'offset' in combination with 'limitRowCount' allows to get a subset of activities.

orderBy.description: Order by filter criteria. Supported format is fieldName:(asc/desc).

check-health.description: View health monitoring data for an Oracle Database Cloud Service instance. Note: Health monitoring metrics are updated on an hourly basis. As a result, the metrics might be slightly out-of-date until the next hourly refresh.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

componentName.description: Name of the service component instance

add-ssh-public-key.description: Add a new SSH public key.

serviceType.description: To determine the type of service

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance

credentialName.description: Credential name to add the SSH public key to. Valid values include ['vmspublickey'].
